intro: Sebastiania hispida var. patula, commonly known as the velvetleaf sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Central and South America, where it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its dark green, velvety leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This species is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid, low-light conditions.
